definition: (an award of financial support for a student to pursue their higher education).
examples: He won a scholarship at the age of 16 and was teaching physics at 19.
She won a scholarship to study law at Harvard University.

definition: (the act of accepting or allowing someone to enter a place or organization).
examples: Many students qualify for admission to the university this year.
He submitted an application for admission to the university.
She applied for admission to the club.

definition: (an amount of money is given to be used for a particular purpose such as education research).
examples: The college awarded him a grant of $50,000 to study law at Harvard University.
He was granted money to buy a house.

definition: (the whole range of conditions and activities in which learning happens).
examples: The trust and bond between a teacher and students create a perfect learning environment.
My school is the perfect learning environment.

definition: (the act of going to a foreign country to study).
examples: I am going to study abroad next year, but I don't know where.
Study abroad nowadays is one of the fastest ways to enter and settle in your favorite countries.

definition: (a year between leaving high school and starting university that someone spends on working or travelling).
examples: Some students decide to take a gap year before they begin university.
After finishing school, she took a gap year and travelled through the UK and Canada.

definition: (to have a casual conversation).
examples: She's always gossiping.
I like having a good gossip now and then.

definition: (someone who spends a lot of time reading).
examples: My brother is a bookworm. He is always reading.
I am not a bookworm. I do not like to read.

definition: (a system of education in which teachers and students do not meet in a classroom but use the Internet or TV programmes and e-mail to have classes).
examples: It is possible for pupils in rural communities to take advantage of distance learning educational programmes.
Thanks to distance learning, many students no longer have to attend classes in person, but can study online.

definition: (to register, or enter in a list for an activity or for membership in a group).
examples: Mary has enrolled in an advanced painting class last week in order to improve her craft.
There are currently over 500 students enrolled in our French Language Program.

word: To play truant = to skive off
definition: (to purposefully not attend a class without permission).
examples: It is bad news when youngsters begin to play truant from school.
He often played truant and wrote his own sick notes.

definition: (not present in a place where you are expected to be).
examples: He is often absent from school.
She has been absent from his desk for two weeks.

word: Do an exam = sit an exam = take an exam
definition: (to do a test).
examples: I have to sit an exam next week.
I'm taking my English exam tomorrow.

definition: (to do a course again because you have failed it the first time).
examples: Students do not need special permission to retake a course.
May I retake a course for a higher grade?

definition: (the act of compelling people obey a particular law or rule).
examples: He works in law enforcement.
The enforcement of laws relating to environmental protection has always been difficult.

definition: (at an unhurried, relaxed, slow speed).
examples: Let's start at a slow pace.
We could walk the entire distance at a slow pace.
We strolled along at a leisurely pace.

definition: (a test conducted under strict, regulated conditions).
examples: She had to take a formal examination before she could graduate.
He is preparing for her certification examination.

definition: (to leave college or university before you have finished your studies).
examples: Too many students drop out of college after only one year.
He dropped out of college after his first semester because of money.
She dropped out of college in her second year.

definition: (a child not yet old enough to go to school).
examples: I wanted to see how far my son's concepts went in math when he was a preschooler.
When I was a preschooler, I had a dentist named Dr. Williams.

definition: (a school which provides students with the special skills and education that they need to do a particular job).
examples: The curriculum at a vocational school is more career-focused.
The vocational school provides education for young people so that they can qualify themselves.

definition: (producing or achieving a lot of results).
examples: I had a very productive day of working yesterday.
Our last meeting was very productive.

definition: (a school for children between the ages of five and eleven).
examples: Learning to write is one of the most important things that a child at primary school will learn.
My sister is a primary school teacher.
I have studied English since I was in a primary school.

definition: (a school for children who are aged from 11, 16 to 18).
examples: She taught history at a secondary school.
When I was in a secondary school, all I ever wanted is a job to pay all the bills.

definition: (a school that awards advanced academic degrees).
examples: He finally earned a Master degree in post-graduate school.
She is a full-time student on post-graduate school.

definition: (paying close attention to something).
examples: He is an attentive student.
Mary asked Tom to be attentive during meetings.
The speaker likes to have an attentive audience.

definition: (to learn or understand a language completely).
examples: If you want to master a language, you need to learn to think in that language.
In order to master a language, you must Listen, Read, Speak, Write, in that order.

definition: (the ability to master other languages).
examples: Her linguistic ability served her well in her chosen profession.
The new recruit was tested to have good linguistic ability.

definition: (to speak easily and quickly).
examples: The students were trained to speak fluently and without unnecessary hesitations.
She speaks several languages fluently.

definition: (to start to study a language).
examples: I've decided to take up a language.
It's just as important to take up a language you enjoy since it would be helpful in everyday life.

definition: (the process of passing knowledge from one person to another).
examples: Universities are involved in the production and transmission of knowledge.
It's a cultural transmission of knowledge from generation to generation.

definition: (involving a lot of work, effort or activity done in a short period of time).
examples: An intensive course of treatment will take at least several days.
This is an intensive course in business writing.

definition: (to think about, work on, watch, or listen to someone or something carefully).
examples: He didn't pay attention to details.
She's never paid that much attention to his opinions.
He paid no attention to her warning.

definition: (to put a lot of your attention on one thing).
examples: He focused on his studies.
She focused on her work.

definition: (the details of a person's family, education, career, wealth).
examples: Poverty can affect anyone, regardless of age, race, gender or social background.
Despite their different social backgrounds, they became good friends.

definition: (to grow, improve or develop very quickly).
examples: Many children who make a slow start but then make progress rapidly.
Julia progresses rapidly in her music lessons.

definition: (to change something so that it is suitable for a new use or purpose, or in a new situation).
examples: Tom soon adapted himself to school life.
The young adapted themselves to the change quickly.

definition: ((of two or more people or things) acting with each other).
examples: The class was very interactive during the class discussion.
The training was very interactive.
Her classes were very interactive; students were reading, writing, talking, and reflecting in meaningful ways.

definition: (to study in the traditional way, with the teacher and students present in the room).
examples: In his opinion, face to face learning will benefit the learner the most.
They preferred face-to-face learning for communication purposes.
Learning activities still take place in a face-to-face learning scenario.

definition: (to give comments (how well or badly), corrections or information about a person's performance of a task).
examples: I liked the way the professor gave feedbacks to his students.
Once he found a mistake on the unfinished release draft, he gave feedbacks and corrections immediately.

definition: (refers to a method of teaching and learning in which teachers encourage students to be part of the lesson instead of passive observers (teachers and students acting with each other)).
examples: Interactive learning is a hands-on approach to help students become more engaged and retain more material.
Each class has been designed to maximise interactive learning, deliberation, and reflection.

definition: (education beyond high school, usually provided by a college or university).
examples: Some school leavers prefer to start work rather than enter higher education.
My brother moved to the United Kingdom (UK) to continue his higher education.

definition: (a course which provides students with the skills and education that they need to do a particular job).
examples: For every four students who start a vocational course in upper secondary, one drops out.
Peter chose a vocational course at the secondary level.

definition: (to interrupt the lesson by causing a disturbance or problem).
examples: There are many reasons why pupils disrupt lessons.
It's very hard to call out pupils who consistently talk or disrupt lessons if you don't know their names.

definition: (required, compulsory).
examples: It is mandatory that all students take two years of English.
It is mandatory to comply with the legislation.

definition: (relating to education).
examples: I found our trip very educational.
Watching television can be very educational.
Science programs are very educational and interesting for both children and adults.

definition: (relating to education, schools, universities, and scholarship).
examples: These phrases are more suitable for academic essays.
He's certainly bright, but he's not very academic.

definition: (the mood or feeling that exists in a class and affects the students who are there).
examples: Games offer students a fun-filled and relaxing learning atmosphere.
New emerging technology makes learning atmosphere pleasant and conductive.

definition: (not falling within the scope of a regular course, work or studies in school or college).
examples: The students took a lot of interest in extra-curricular activities.
We have extra-curricular activities after school.

definition: (a person who gives lectures at a college or university).
examples: The lecturer illustrated his point with a diagram on the blackboard.
The lecturer would end up her speech with a joke.

definition: (subjects relating to education, schools, universities, etc).
examples: History is an academic subject.
We've learnt a variety of academic subjects.

definition: (if you do badly in an exam it is because the test was too hard).
examples: She is a good student. She's never done badly in an exam.
Have you ever done badly in an exam?

definition: (a detailed record of student's marks or grades that they have received at a school).
examples: If the student wants a copy of his transcript, he should go to the Registrar's Office.
Each applicant must submit his transcript with his application.

definition: ( a temporary job that a student or new graduate takes in order to get practical experience in the area they want to work in).
examples: Your ability to write about your internship experience on your resume is incredibly important.
Jane has a summer internship at a local TV station.

definition: ( activities that students do at school or college that are not part of their course).
examples: We have extracurricular activities after school.
Generally, volunteer activities aren't always extracurricular activities.

definition: (ways of life).
examples: Advertisements have greatly affected our social and cultural life.
Ethiopia's coffee ceremony is an integral part of their social and cultural life.

definition: (the amount of money that you pay for your education).
examples: Tuition fees are free and the teaching methods and facilities are great.
The tuition fees went up this year.

definition: (to allow someone to do or have what they want).
examples: Did they grant Tom permission to leave?
He was granted a patent on his invention.
He was granted admission to the university.

definition: (a large room where a lot of people in a school or institution sleep).
examples: He lived in a college dormitory.
She was reading a math textbook in the dormitory.
He hangs out in the school dormitory.

definition: (to take great effort and self-discipline).
examples: We will help your child reach his full potential.
Our hope for Bill is that he will reach his full potential.

definition: (a first university degree (a degree awarded by a college or university)).
examples: It took him six years to get his bachelor's degree in math.
I graduated from City University with a bachelor's degree in law.

definition: (to study very hard).
examples: I have to go home and hit the books because I have a big test tomorrow.
It's time to hit the books.

definition: (an advanced college or university degree, which follows after bachelor's degree).
examples: I have got a Master's degree in Business Administration.
He got his master's degree three years ago.

definition: (a student at a college or university who's older than others).
examples: He studied law as a mature student.
## There are many benefits to being a mature student.

definition: (a school that is supported and paid for by the government).
examples: ## He was educated at a public school.
My son finished a public school a few years ago.

definition: (a very simple, basic and foolish mistake).
examples: Lucy made a schoolboy error on her English test.
Tom made a schoolboy error by accepting a lunch invitation from a journalist.

definition: (schools that have only one sex (for either boys or girls)).
examples: My sister happily attended a single-sex school for 6 years.
I would never send my kids to a single-sex school.

definition: (to go to classes).
examples: In European universities, students are not required to attend classes.
Do not waste your money on tuition if you are not even going to attend classes.
Some students may not be able to pass the test in class because they don't attend classes regularly.

definition: (to memorize something).
examples: You should try to learn by heart these English words and phrases.
The boy learned the poem by heart.

definition: (to finish something in time (by or before it is due)).
examples: I'm trying to meet a deadline.
Do you take personal responsibility for failing to meet a deadline?

definition: (to achieve, or accomplish something very successfully).
examples: He is studying hard and he will pass IELTS with flying colours.
He passed his exams with flying colours.
She passed her job interview with flying colours.

definition: (to follow a course (education)).
examples: Peter would like to pursue studies in the future to become a lawyer.
She wants to pursue studying after high school.

definition: (to spend one year working to gain more valuable experience).
examples: Many graduates want to take a year out to save the money they need to embark on a course of further study.
My son took a year out and went traveling to Japan.
She took a year out to travel around South America.

definition: (to give full your attention to something).
examples: He couldn't concentrate on his lessons. His mind was on other things.
You might need to concentrate on what you're reading in order to understand it.
If you make so much noise, I can't concentrate on my homework.

definition: (something that prevents you from giving full attention to something else).
examples: He worked hard all morning, without distraction.
The baby's constant crying drove me to distraction.
My kids drive me to distraction at times.

definition: (a long piece of writing that is submitted in support of candidature for an academic degree).
examples: Sarah has been working on her thesis for over a year and she still has lots of work to do.
Lucy wrote her doctoral thesis on contemporary Germany literature.

definition: (work that you must do as part of a job or course of study).
examples: I'm feeling much more confident in doing my first college assignment.
He stayed up all night finishing his assignment.
The student apologized for handing in his assignment late due to his illness.

definition: (a disagreement or argument about something).
examples: His views have excited a lively controversy among fellow scientists.
His latest book has attracted a lot of controversy.

definition: (based on theories or ideas that relate to a subject instead of on practical application).
examples: The training is practical rather than theoretical.
## The course is designed to be practical rather than theoretical.

definition: (not to be good at something).
examples: I am poor at drawing.
## He is very poor at maths at school.

definition: (an official document shows that an educational program has been completed).
examples: The language certificate has three levels: basic, intermediate and advanced.
TOEFL, TOEIC and IELTS are English certificates which aim for academic use and are widely used around the world.

definition: (a document given by a college or university to show that you have completed an educational program (finished your studies)).
examples: Have you actually seen Tom's diploma?
He is a commerce graduate with a diploma in computer applications.

definition: (the qualification that you get after completing a course of study at a university).
examples: It took him six years to get his bachelor's degree in math.
My sister got her law degree in 2010.

definition: (to take an examination again).
examples: The teacher forced him to resit the exam the week after.
Pupils who score less than 5 marks have to resit the test.

definition: (to miss a class or not go to a class for some reason).
examples: He often skips classes.
Bullied students tend to skip classes because they feel uncomfortable at school.

definition: (something or event that is easily remembered, usually because it is special or unusual).
examples: His wedding was a memorable event for all.
Graduation ceremony is a memorable event for all students.

definition: (a special field of study).
examples: Her specialty is English literature.
His specialty is criminal law.

definition: (to receive, to get).
examples: An internship will help students gain experience.
Reading books is a way to gain knowledge.

definition: (a plan for doing a list of things at certain times).
examples: He always has a full schedule.
She has been forced to adjust her schedule.

definition: (to be exciting and makes someone feel strongly interested in).
examples: What he said at the meeting today was very inspiring.
I find these quotes very inspiring.

definition: (providing someone with satisfaction, pleasure, or profit).
examples: Teaching young children is a challenging and rewarding job.
I find learning languages to be very rewarding.

definition: (training that emphasizes skills and knowledge required for a particular job).
examples: Although vocational training is career-oriented, a few types of professions require a college degree.

definition: (to relax after hours of hard work).
examples: Listening to music helps me to unwind after a busy day at work.
Meditation is a tool that can help people unwind and let go of stress.

definition: (giving someone confidence or hope about something).
examples: He sent me an encouraging message.
A coach is encouraging his team.
Parents often use encouraging words to motivate their children to achieve high standards.

definition: (if you are strict, you have definite rules and expect people to obey completely).
examples: Her English teacher is very strict.
Both of my parents are not strict with me.

definition: (giving someone support, encouragement, and advice).
examples: My girlfriend was very supportive when I was ill.
His boss was very supportive and gave him time off work.

definition: (to keep an eye on something).
examples: I can't keep track of the new music.
Bank statements help you keep track of where your money is going.

definition: (to make great efforts to achieve something).
examples: We must strive to secure steady growth.
He strove very hard to remain calm.

definition: (a short period of time for relaxation).
examples: ## Let's take a short break.
We usually have a short break for lunch, then start to work again at 2 o'clock.

definition: (the fact of showing your honesty of mind).
examples: ## He impressed her with his sincerity.
If you question her sincerity, do not ask for her help.

definition: (to give someone or reveal information about something).
examples: I can't disclose that information yet.
## He disclosed to me that he had been in prison.

definition: (to remember something that happened in the past).
examples: I can't recall his name at the moment.
## I failed to recall the book's title.

definition: (a large amount of work or many tasks to perform).
examples: Due to the heavy workload, many employees suffer from depression.
He's struggling to cope with the heavy workload.

definition: (using superior strength repeatedly and intentionally to frighten or hurt another person).
examples: The older boy causes problems at school by bullying younger children.
Bullying isn't just done with kids, adults bully each other too.

definition: (to be capable of doing something well).
examples: Tom is regarded as the most competent employee.
She is a competent teacher.

definition: (to be extremely good at something).
examples: He excels in sports and in many other activities.
Rebecca always excels in languages at school.

word: To fall behind with your studies
definition: (to progress more slowly in studying than other people).
examples: These students regularly miss classes and fall behind with their studies.

definition: (to make students obey the rules of a school or college).
examples: The teacher misused his ability to impose discipline on his students.

definition: (a record of how often someone has been present at an event or an institution).
examples: He has a good attendance record.
Lucy, who is a fine student, has a perfect attendance record.

definition: (education for people at college or university level).
examples: More than 50% of secondary school pupils going on to tertiary education.
Excessive alcohol used by tertiary education students is well documented.

definition: (to gather or collect something gradually as time passes).
examples: He accumulated a large fortune by hard work.
People tend to spend a greater proportion of their incomes when they accumulate more wealth.

definition: (a book, novel etc read at bedtime).
examples: Bedtime reading with your child can have a fantastic effect on enhancing your child's attention span.
Bedtime reading helps get children to sleep.
Can you remember your kindergarten teacher's name?
He and I have been friends since kindergarten.

definition: (someone who has spoken a language since he/she was a baby and did not learn it as a foreign language).
examples: Speak like a native speaker by using sentence stress in English.
He doesn't think it's necessary for him to sound like a native speaker, he just wants to be able to speak fluently.

word: To have a good grasp of
definition: (to have a complete, clear understanding of something).
examples: He doesn't have a good grasp of the principles yet.
After taking a year-long computer course, Peter had a good grasp of computer programming.
